mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic studies on Anthaxiina Gory & Laporte de Castelnau and Curina Ho y ski (Coleoptera: Buprestidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
As mentioned above, the genus
Brasilaxia
remains monotypic with close relations to the genus
Bilyaxia
Holyñski, 1989
.

The nomenclatural situation in this group is rather complicated and needs the following comments: In 1989 , Holyñski published “The content and systematic position of
Cylindrophora
Solier, 1851
”. The introductory paragraph of this paper is the most crucial for the whole case: he misquoted the date of Solier´s monograph —
Solier, 1849
and not
1851
(evidently having followed
Cobos, 1956
who also synonymized in the same revision the genera
Brasilaxia
and
Ctenoderus
Germain, 1856
with the subgenus
Cylindrophora
Solier, 1849
of his widely accepted genus
Anthaxia
); this problem was clearly explained by Bellamy ( 1999 ), i.e. there is no mention of Buprestidae in the volume dated 1851 of Solier’s work. In the same paragraph Holyñski mentioned ”
Cylindrophora marginicollis
Solier, 1851
(=
A. verecunda
Erichson, 1834
) as the type species of the genus
Cylindrophora
Solier, 1851
.” As already explained by Bellamy ( 1999 ),
A. marginicollis
was described quite independently (before the description of
Cylindrophora
) and cannot be, in this way, the type species of
Cylindrophora .
The genus
Cylindrophora
was described in the following text with two species included:
Buprestis bella
Guérin­Menéville, 1830
(junior synonym of
Chrysomela maulica
Molina, 1782
) and ”
Buprestis concinna Germar
”. The combination ”
B. concinna Germar
” doesn´t exist (
Buprestis concinna
was described by
Mannerheim 1837
); in this case
Chrysomela maulica
Molina, 1782
(with synonym
Buprestis bella
Guérin­Menéville, 1830
) must be the type species of the genus
Cylindrophora
Solier, 1849
— a fact which changes the whole situation in Anthaxiina and Curina.

Because
Holyñski ( 1989 )
supposed (and I do agree with him) ”
A. verecunda
(=
A. marginicollis
)” not to be congeneric with
Anthaxia
or with the rest of species included so far in the subgenus
Cylindrophora sensu
Cobos ( 1956 )
, and because he supposed it erroneously to be the type species of
Cylindrophora ,
he created for the remaining species a new subgeneric name:
Bilyaxia
Holyñski, 1989
. He also recognized that two more species formerly included in the subgenus
Cylindrophora sensu
Cobos ( 1956 )
should have been shifted to a separate genus:
A. oyarcei
(described in the genus
Curis Gory & Laporte, 1838
) and
A. chloris
Germain, 1856
(described as the only species of the genus
Ctenoderus
) and he suggested to treat them in a separate subgenus
Ctenoderus
of the genus
Curis
(now
Selagis
Dejean, 1836
— see
Bellamy, 2003
). The position of the next ”enigmatic” species mentioned by
Holyñski ( 1989 )
—
Curis cinctipennis
Kerremans, 1913
was solved by
Cobos ( 1971 )
who attributed it to the subgenus
Cylindrophora
. Having studied the holotype , I agree and find this species to be very near to
Bilyaxia bucki (
Cobos, 1956
)
.

I consider the differences between
Selagis
,
Ctenoderus
and
Cylindrophora
to be sufficient for their treatment as separate genera of Curina
Holyñski, 1988
; moreover a new genus name must be created for the remaining species,
Anthaxia verecunda (
Erichson, 1834
)
, which should be also included in the Curina as a rather isolated, monotypic genus. It cannot be the type species of
Cylindrophora
Solier, 1849
which has now quite different content, as explained above.
